title: The week in tennis: Zverev wins in Paris, and the ATP Finals spots are locked in
description: With Djokovic out, the last three ATP Finals spots have been determined, while Zverev had a big victory in France this week.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Tyler, the Creator name-drops Coco Gauff in new album
description: The tennis star was mentioned in the rapper's seventh studio album.
author: Kalan Hooks

title: 13 Ways to DESTROY Your Tennis Competition (Legally) - Essential Tennis Podcast #413

title: Swiatek exits WTA Finals after Krejcikova win
description: Iga Swiatek is knocked out of the WTA Finals after group rival Barbora Krejcikova beat Coco Gauff to secure her place in the semi-finals.

title: Resurgent Norrie reaches 25th ATP semi-final
description: Britain's Cameron Norrie continues his positive end to an injury-hit season by reaching the Moselle Open semi-finals.

title: Sinner, Zverev, Alcaraz & co. arrive in Turin
description: Jannik Sinner, Alexander Zverev, Carlos Alcaraz, and fellow Nitto ATP Finals competitors have arrived in Turin. Players were greeted by thousands of fans as they walked the blue carpet at the Piazza Carlo Alberto, one of Turin's most picturesque squares, where a tournament promotion was projected onto the facade of the National Library. Andrey has entered the building üôå#NittoATPFinals pic.twitter.com/wgFJMJaATG‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) November 7, 2024 It‚Äôs @AlexZverev time ‚ú® #NittoATPFinals pic.twitter.com/012oMKHZDS‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) November 7, 2024 Taylor came to serve üòé#NittoATPFinals pic.twitter.com/QzkRwU6GCS‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) November 7, 2024 Casper coming through with the florals üå∑ #NittoATPFinals pic.twitter.com/h18NnnOxg4‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) November 7, 2024 [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Did Medvedev have a sixth sense about Turin streak?
description: When Daniil Medvedev finished the 2018 season at a then career-high No. 17 in the PIF ATP Rankings, little did he know that he would continue his climb and embark on a six-year streak competing at the prestigious Nitto ATP Finals. Medvedev, who went 0-3 in his tournament debut in 2019 followed by a title run in 2020, is a perennial threat to become the champion of champions in Turin. This year is no different.But the six-year streak has caught even Medvedev by surprise. ‚ÄúProbably if you asked me in 2018, when I was not there, you‚Äôd say, ‚ÄòSix times in a row I‚Äôm going to be there‚Äô, I‚Äôd like be, ‚ÄòWow! How? You need to win Masters 1000s, you need to play good at the Slams, and at that time I wasn‚Äôt doing it yet, even if I was going up. So I‚Äôm pretty happy about it,‚Äù Medvedev told ATP Media. ‚ÄúHappy to be here and looking forward.‚ÄùYour 2024 Champions. A new era. üèÜ#NittoATPFinals pic.twitter.com/VRWm1BcejT‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) November 7, 2024 The 28-year-old reflected on his 2024 season, during which he has tallied a 45-19 match record, labelling it as an ‚Äúup and down‚Äù year with ‚Äúsome positives and some negatives‚Äù. After lifting a career-best five titles in 2023, Medvedev is short on time as he continues to seek his first trophy of the season. The Australian Open and Indian Wells finalist is placed in the Ilie Nastase Group alongside Jannik Sinner, Taylor Fritz and Alex de Minaur. Medvedev and Fritz will kickstart the singles action on Sunday in what will be just their second Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting. ‚ÄúWith Taylor, it‚Äôs pretty crazy because we‚Äôve both been Top 10 for like three years and we kind of started to be on Tour at the same time and we‚Äôve only played each other one time, which is crazy,‚Äù said Medvedev, who beat Fritz in Cincinnati in 2022. [ATP APP] After Medvedev won his first six tour-level matches against Sinner, the Italian has forged a major turnaround in the pair‚Äôs Lexus ATP Head2Head series, which now stands at 7-7. Medvedev and Sinner clashed five times this season (Sinner 4-1), including at three of the majors. ‚ÄúYou need to play an inch-perfect match to beat [Jannik],‚Äù Medvedev said. ‚ÄúFrom start to finish, you need to be there, you need to make him tired physically and work him out. If you are not able to do it from the start, he gets control of the match and it‚Äôs tough to break his rhythm. Very, very tough opponent, especially here in Italy.‚Äù Boasting an 11-9 career record at the season finale, Medvedev will look to gain revenge on Nitto ATP Finals debutant De Minaur, who defeated the 20-time tour-level titlist at Roland Garros this year. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve known Alex for a long time. For me, he was always a great tennis player,‚Äù Medvedev said. ‚Äú[Before], maybe a bit too much up and down, where he could have some amazing matches or even in the same match ‚Äî he could have some amazing points where he runs from one side of the court to another one and makes a highlight for the season. And then during the same match, he would go a little bit down, make some mistakes, and this year that was not the case. ‚ÄúI feel like that‚Äôs what made this season better than his previous ones ‚Äî the consistency he was able to find throughout the whole year and throughout the whole matches.‚Äù [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Nitto ATP Finals Draw 2024
description: The 2024 ATP Finals group stages have been drawn. Top seed Jannik Sinner and former champion Daniil Medvedev will headline the Ilie Nastase Group, while fifth seed Taylor Fritz and tournament newcomer Alex de Minaur will also participate. In the John Newcombe Group, second seed Alexander Zverev and this year‚Äôs Roland Garros and Wimbledon champion ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Wilson RF 01 Playtest and Review
description: In this review, I explore the RF 01, a racket designed by Roger Federer to bring elements of his game to a broader audience. Wilson says it‚Äôs the line of rackets Federer would have used if he had successfully recovered from knee surgery in 2021. Sadly, we all know that never happened, so we can‚Äôt ‚Ä¶
author: Martina
